Text:
This worked for me.

Though it said during installation that my system was not known and thus not supported, it just run fine and good. I guess the 'known' and supported distros are the major commercial supported ones: RH, SUSE, Ubuntu, Mandriva.

Anyhow in my case, I run a Debian Squeeze 6.0.4 with the following:

~$ uname -a
Linux e01 2.6.32-5-686 #1 SMP Mon Mar 26 05:20:33 UTC 2012 i686 GNU/Linux

~$ lspci | egrep "(VGA|Audio)"
00:1b.0 Audio device: Intel Corporation 82801I (ICH9 Family) HD Audio Controller (rev 02)
04:00.0 VGA compatible controller: nVidia Corporation GT218 [GeForce 210] (rev a2)
04:00.1 Audio device: nVidia Corporation High Definition Audio Controller (rev a1)

~$ free -m
             total       used       free     shared    buffers     cached
Mem:          3041       2502        538          0         36       1575
-/+ buffers/cache:        890       2150
Swap:         3861          0       3861

~$ cat /proc/cpuinfo | grep "model name" | head -1
model name	: Intel(R) Core(TM)2 Quad  CPU   Q8200  @ 2.33GHz

Using:  NVIDIA Accelerated Graphics Driver for Linux-x86 (version: 256.53)

Thanks for sharing.
